name: CouchDB Conf Berlin
body:
# CouchDB Conf Berlin

A CouchDB Conference & CouchCamp

[Co-Up](http://co-up.de/)
Berlin, Germany

Friday - Sunday, January 25th-27th, 2013


## Tickets

50 tickets, 50€. (TITO)


## Programme

### Friday, January 25th, 10:00-18:00

A full day of regular conferencing with presentations from and for developers and users.

09:30 - Opening & Registration

10:00 - 10:15 Welcome

10:15 - 10:45 Talk
10:45 - 11:15 Talk

11:15 - 11:30 Break

11:30 - 12:00 Talk
12:00 - 12:30 Talk

12:30 - 14:00 Lunch

14:00 - 14:30 Talk
14:30 - 15:00 Talk

15:00 - 15:15 Break

15:15 - 15:45 Talk
15:45 - 16:15 Talk

16:15 - 16:30 Break

16:30 - 17:00 Talk
17:00 - 17:30 Talk

17:30 - 18:00 Closing Notes

18:00+ Drinks, Hacking, Dinner, Drinks


### Saturday, January 26th, 10:00-18:00

A BarCamp-style unconference with talks and hack-sessions by the participants. With focus on:

 - Getting started with CouchDB
 - Advanced programming with CouchDB
 - CouchDB Administration
 - The CouchDB Ecosystem with:
  - BigCouch
  - PouchDB
  - TouchDB
 - Introduction to Erlang & CouchDB Hacking
 - Core CouchDB Development
 - General hack sessions on and around CouchDB


### Sunday, January 27th 10:00-18:00

Same as Saturday, but with breakout time for CouchDB Core Developers to discuss internals and roadmap, done in a panel, so that asipiring contributors & users can peek in and learn.


## Call for Speakers

We are inviting the CouchDB Community to submit talks for the upcoming CouchDB Conf Berlin (January 25-27, 2013). This Call for Speakers **closes on December 10th, 2012**.

### Topics

We are interested in talks about the whole spectrum of CouchDB:

 - Getting Started with CouchDB and Related Technologies
 - Advanced CouchDB Features
 - CouchDB Operation
 - Developing Apps with CouchDB (web, mobile, you name it)
 - CouchDB in Practice. Your experiences with CouchDB
 - BigCouch
 - PouchDB
 - TouchDB
 - GeoCouch
 - CouchDB Internals


### We Can Help

Not everybody is a natural talent on stage. Not everybody can produce kick-ass slide-decks. Not everybody is a live-demo-god. Not everybody knows they have something great to talk about.

There are about a million reasons why you don’t consider yourself a speaker. We are here to prove you wrong. If all you have is a gut feeling that you should be on stage, we are here to reach out and help you to develop or hone the skills you think you lack to deliver a great presentation.

 - We are happy to brainstorm your interests to see if a great topic is hiding.
 - We are happy to connect you with experienced speakers to help prepare your submission.
 - We are happy to review and advise on how to produce a slide deck. If you don’t feel creative, just use our Keynote or PowerPoint templates.
 - If you need practice giving talks, get in touch, we can hook you up with local groups or set up a stage for you and a bunch of friends in advance, so you can practice in front of a friendly crowd.
 - Again, whatever else you might need, we’re here to help.

Get in touch: contact@jsconf.eu (just don’t use this to submit a proposal).

If you need more encouragement, check out co-organiser Tiffany’s site [We Are All Awesome](http://weareallaweso.me/) that tries to convince you to speak.


### The Perks

CouchDB Conf Berlin is a low-budget community event. We can offer:

 - An excuse to go to Berlin (yay!)
 - Helping out the CouchDB community
 - An excuse to give a talk
 - A friendly audience
 - Meet fellow CouchDB enthusiasts
 - Have a great time

If your talk gets accepted and you have absolutely no means of getting to Berlin, please get in touch, we have a small budget and supporters that might be able to help. If you can convince your employer to pay for your travels, we are happy to list them as a supporting sponsor.


### The Selection Process

The selection will be completely arbirary, based on the whims of the organisers. We want to make sure to create a balanced conference day.


### Guidelines

Submit your talk by December 10th, 2012, 23:59:59 CEST.

All talks are in English. Talks are 30 minutes long, including Q&A.

Keep your proposals short, 2-3 paragraphs and a short bit about yourself will do.

We are trying to get a recording set up, either audio or video. You will retain full ownership of your slides and recording and we’d like to ask you to make your materials and recording available under a creative commons (we default to no commercial reuse) or other open source license.


### Submit Your Talk

IFRAME


## The Venue

We are meeting at the lovely Coworking place [Co.Up](http://co-up.de/). They have enough seating for everybody, breakout rooms for hacking, great coffee, fast internet and plenty of tasty food nearby.


## Call for Sponsors

If you want to Sponsor CouchDB Conf Berlin, please get in touch.
